addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable my very singular good Lord
e highe Treasuro
r
of England.

section.hand:
23 Au
g
1590
M
r
Bodleley for
Trogmort
o
to have.
Ca
p
Smyth
[b
a
d]

page.lettertext:
fol.208r
May it please yo
r
good L. There is lately
deceased at
Disbourgh
Captain Smith, whose
Lieutenant John Throckmorton, hath bin alwaies
esteemed an honest, and a valiant gentleman:
wherof his service made proofe, at
e last encoun-
ter, at
e victualling of
Becke
. I thinke
S
r
Francis Vere
, who hath alwaies commended him,
for he valew and conduct, will affourd him
that testimonie,
at is dewe unto him. He
was first lieutenant to
Captain Hart
, and
after his decease became suto
r
for his captains
rowme, whiche was then conferred uppon
Captain Hunninges
, and after againe uppon
Captain Smith, who being departed, if
nowe
e third time he should not be respected,
it would muche discourage both him and others,
that serve as Lieutenants: whiche yo
r
L.
I trust, will take in good part, that I signi-
fie thus boldly,
and so I take my humble
leave. From
e
Hage
. Au
g
23
A
o
90.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden
Tho. Bodley
